answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Hi Matt,
I was able to find some resources for you on the Knowledge Network.
In Alachua County, FL's Green Infrastructure Investment Program, you can get some insight into Alachua's land acquisition policy and procedures.
http://icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/2767
This blog post, entitled The History of Sustainable Development-Connecting the Dots, provides information a firm that was heavily involved in the development of one of Florida's land acquisition programs.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpost/115/The_History_of_Sustainable_Development__Connecting_the_Dots
And here are a couple of external resources:
Franklin County, OH's policy:
http://www.franklincountyengineer.org/land_acquisition_policy.htm
Illinois Dept. of Transportation's policy:
http://www.dot.state.il.us/landacq/lappm.html
News about India's new policy:
http://www.asianewsnet.net/news-40213.html
And Arizona's Water Infrastructure Finance Authority's policy
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=23&ved=0CEYQFjACOBQ&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.azwifa.gov%2Fdownload.aspx%3Fpath%3Dwifa-policies%2FIII_Loan_Origination%2F%26file%3DIII.14%2520Land%2520Acquisition%2520Policy.pdf&ei=wKZAUab0OMnC4APU84FY&usg=AFQjCNEm3hHn_Kq-jAD5JJc2tncNKkhCbQ&sig2=qLawkUdGJh8Qg4jORMxfzw&bvm=bv.43287494,d.dmg&cad=rja
I hope this helps to answer your question. Please let us know if you need any more information.
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Depending on the laws of the state and what is allowed, if a state permits a community to create a community redevelopment agency then generally the focus of a community will be on the designated area covered by the CRA and there is usually an overall plan which includes an aquisition policy.  Florida and its cities can be a good resource for such plans and policies which can offer ideas.  Absent a a CRA setting, in my experience, it is usually specific to a targeted goal rather than a citywide policy and is usually driven by a specific potential industry or private investment.  There is certainly nothing wrong with the approach you are contemplating but from an economic development perspective, it would be very wise to undertake any land aquisitions based on a clearly defined plan with a solid marketing goal to attract new investment or you do risk taking property off the tax rolls and being stuck with them.

author: Matthew McQuillen
text:
In Clive we have an older area of the community we have been trying to redevelopment for a number of years.  Some of our elected officials are wanting to pick up the pace of redevelopment by considering some land acquisitions in the area.  This discussion brought up a larger topic of having an overall land acquisition policy for the City.  I have some ideas on what we might include in a policy draft but I wanted to see if other cities have tried this overall policy approach or if it is more specific to a certain part of the community?
I thank you in advance for any information you can provide!
Matt McQuillen
title: Land Acquisition Policy
